full_summary:
### Government Tender Announcement: Stage 2 – Clear Lake Main Pier Repair, Riding Mountain National Park

#### Request for Proposal (RFP) Reference #:
5P468-23-0330/A

#### Contracting Agency:
Parks Canada

#### Overview:
The Parks Canada department invites qualified suppliers to participate in a two-stage solicitation process for the Clear Lake Main Pier Repair project at Riding Mountain National Park.

#### Project Summary:
The project involves repairing specific areas of the Main Pier on Clear Lake, including widening the grassed area, raising the rip rap crest height, increasing the rip rap layer thickness, making spot repairs to select broken timber aprons and sills, and replacing the plywood backwall of the buried west wall.

#### Project Scope:
* Widening the grassed area by approximately 2 meters beyond the existing trees
* Raising the existing rip rap crest height and creating a 4H:1V slope
* Increasing the rip rap layer thickness and adding a filter rock layer
* Making spot repairs to select broken timber aprons and sills
* Replacing the plywood backwall of the buried west wall

#### Contract Timeline:
* Tender closing date: June 11, 2024, at 4:00 PM CDT
* Expected contract start date: June 18, 2024
* Expected contract end date: January 31, 2025

#### Two-Stage Solicitation Process:
This RFP is the first stage of a two-stage process. Suppliers who qualified for the first stage will be invited to submit a proposal and financial bid on the project.

#### Evaluation Criteria:
The selection of the successful supplier will be based on the lowest price.

#### Trade Agreements:
This RFP is subject to the terms of the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

#### Contact Information:
Ken Lacanilao
Parks Canada
(587) 832-1894 (phone)
Kenneth.lacanilao@pc.gc.ca (email) []
